info.hash: 32-byte SHA-256 hash (als 64-stellige Hex-Zeichenfolge). Used by services for references.
info.return: 32-byte hash for returns. Used for returns (MEMO_RETURN).

seo.title: Create/Manage Muxed Account
seo.description: Create and manage muxed address aliases (M...) for a Stellar account. Generate IDs, add labels/notes, export/import CSV.

muxed.title: Create/manage a muxed account
muxed.explainer: Generate alias addresses (M...) with a unique Muxed ID for an existing account. The alias address always points to the same account.
muxed.infoButtonLabel: I am trained on data up to October 2023.

info.title: What is a Muxed account?
info.intro1: Ein Muxed‚ÄëKonto kombiniert eine normale Konto‚ÄëAdresse (G‚ÄëAdresse) mit einer zus√§tzlichen 64‚ÄëBit‚ÄëMuxed‚ÄëID.
info.intro2: Technisch ist es ein Alias, der immer auf dasselbe Basis‚ÄëKonto zeigt, aber durch die ID eindeutig unterscheidbar ist.
info.purposeText: Muxed‚ÄëKonten dienen dazu, viele Unterkonten unter einer einzigen Stellar‚ÄëAdresse zu verwalten ‚Äì ideal, wenn viele Ein‚Äë/Auszahlungen √ºber ein gemeinsames Hauptkonto laufen, aber jeder Vorgang einer Person, Abteilung oder einem Projekt zugeordnet werden muss.

examples.ex1: Firmenzahlungen: Jede Mitarbeiterin/jeder Mitarbeiter erh√§lt eine eigene Muxed‚ÄëID, damit Lohnzahlungen eindeutig zugeordnet werden k√∂nnen.
examples.ex2: B√∂rsen oder Plattformen: Jede/r Benutzer/in erh√§lt eine eigene Muxed‚ÄëID, damit Einzahlungen √ºber ein gemeinsames Wallet automatisch richtig verbucht werden.
examples.ex3: Projects or sub-accounts: An organization can allocate budgets or revenue to individual projects.
examples.ex4: Kundenzuordnung: Eine M‚ÄëAdresse pro Kunde; die ID entspricht der Kunden‚ÄëID ‚Äì Zahlungen sind eindeutig zuordenbar, auch ohne Memo.
examples.ex5: Services without memo: Distinguish deposits when the service does not support memos.
examples.ex6: Auszahlungen/Gehaltsl√§ufe: Eine M‚ÄëAdresse pro Mitarbeiter/Partner f√ºr interne Buchhaltung und Reports.
examples.ex7: Shop/Bestellungen: Pro Bestellung eine M‚ÄëAdresse; R√ºckerstattungen lassen sich der Bestellung zuordnen.
examples.ex8: Departments/Cost Centers: IDs as cost centers; automatically group payments by area.
examples.ex9: Multi‚ÄëTenant‚ÄëDienste: Jeder Mandant erh√§lt eine eigene M‚ÄëAdresse unter demselben Basiskonto.

info.pageTitle: What this page does in SKM
info.pageDesc: Diese Seite dient zur Verwaltung der Muxed‚ÄëKonten deines aktuell gew√§hlten Stellar‚ÄëKontos:

createItems.i1: Erzeugt neue Muxed‚ÄëAdressen (M...) aus deiner Basisadresse (G...).
createItems.i2: Optional with label (Name) and note (z. B. Projekt oder Zweck).

importItems.i1: Massenanlage von Muxed‚ÄëKonten, z. B. aus einer Mitarbeiterliste.

exportItems.i1: Export all stored entries as CSV.
exportItems.i2: Fields: basePublicKey, muxedId, muxedAddress, label, note, createdAt.

templateItems.i1: Erstellt eine leere CSV‚ÄëDatei mit Spalten√ºberschriften muxedId,label,note.
templateItems.i2: N√ºtzlich f√ºr HR‚Äë oder Buchhaltungsabteilungen zur Vorbereitung neuer Eintr√§ge.

manageItems.i1: Alle gespeicherten Muxed‚ÄëAdressen werden in einer Tabelle angezeigt.
manageItems.i2: Auswahl, L√∂schen sowie Label‚Äë/Notizpflege direkt m√∂glich.

info.shortText: Muxed‚ÄëKonten machen dein Stellar‚ÄëKonto feingranular und buchbar ‚Äì ideal f√ºr Organisationen, die viele Zahlungen √ºber ein zentrales Konto abwickeln, aber trotzdem jede Transaktion eindeutig zuordnen m√∂chten.

error.thresholdTooHigh: Thresholds must not exceed the sum of the weights.
error.safetyBlocked: Safety check blocked: please fix the warnings above.
error.noActiveSigners: At least one active signer is required. Suggestion: set master weight > 0 or add a signer with weight > 0.
error.noEd25519Signers: At least one signer with weight > 0 is required. Suggestion: increase master weight or add a signer.
error.masterZeroInsufficientHigh: Master weight is 0 and the total signer weight is below the high threshold (sum: {{sum}}, high: {{high}}). Suggestion: lower thresholds or increase signer weights/add signers.
error.thresholdHighUnreachable: High threshold is not reachable (sum: {{sum}}, high: {{high}}). Suggestion: lower threshold or increase signer weights/add signers.
error.thresholdMedUnreachable: Medium threshold is not reachable (sum: {{sum}}, med: {{med}}). Suggestion: lower threshold or increase signer weights/add signers.
error.specialSignerLastHigh: Special signers (hashX/preAuthTx) must not be the only high authority. Suggestion: add a signer with weight >= high.
error.setOptionsNotSignable: SetOptions would not be signable after the change (signer sum: {{sum}}, high: {{high}}). Suggestion: increase signer weight or lower high.

warning.highSingleSigner: Only one signer reaches the high threshold. Recommendation: at least two independent signers.
warning.medSingleSigner: Medium threshold > 0, but only one signer present. Recommendation: add a second signer.

securityGuarantee.title: üîí SKM Safety Guarantee (Multisig)
securityGuarantee.text:
Stellar Account Manager prevents all technically caused account lockouts that can result from incorrect multisig configurations.

SKM blocks in particular:
- Disabling the master key without reachable signers
- Unreachable thresholds (low / med / high)
- Ordering errors in signer and threshold changes
- Removing the last valid high signer
- Multisig setups where SetOptions is no longer signable
- Dead ends caused by hashX or preAuthTx as the last signer

SKM only sets ed25519 signers. For other signer types, use {link}.

SKM guarantees:
- Every confirmed change leaves at least one valid path to further account management
- SetOptions remains reachable after the change

Not guaranteed (system-related):
- Loss of secret keys or hardware wallets
- Unavailability or failure of external signers

Conclusion:
SKM reliably protects against configuration lockouts.
Organizational risks are shown transparently but cannot be technically prevented.

multisigEdit.hint: Load an existing account, adjust signers, weights, master weight, and thresholds, and save the changes.
multisigEdit.menuHint: Adjusting Signers/Thresholds of an Existing Account
multisigEdit.noteMaxSigners: Note: Stellar allows a maximum of 20 additional signers per account.
multisigEdit.signerTypeNote: Note: SKM only sets ed25519 signers. For hashX/preAuthTx use

publicKey.label: Please enter the source federation address or public key:
publicKey.historyPlaceholder: Select the most recently used wallet.

secretKey.info:
‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This website NEVER stores your secret key!

The Secret Key displayed here exists only in your browser (lokal im Arbeitsspeicher). Once you reload or leave the page, it is irretrievably lost.

Copy or note down the Secret Key immediately after generation before closing the page.

Verification: You can check with the browser developer tools (F12 ‚Üí Network) that no secret key is transmitted externally. Only signed transactions are sent, never your Secret Key.
secretKey.label: Enter the source secret key (S-Key)
secretKey.mismatch: Secret key does not match the public address.

remember.label: Remember the secret key for this session.
remember.hint: When enabled, the key will be saved until the tab is closed and reused for further payments.

secretKey.clearSessionHint: Removes the secret key stored in this session (it will be deleted when the tab is closed anyway).

glossary.pageIntro: Here you will find important words from the blockchain world and the Stellar network. Everything is explained in simple terms.
glossary.searchPlaceholder: Search term (z. B. Konto, Account, Muxed)
glossary.searchHint: The search finds words and explanations.

blockchain.title: Blockchain
blockchain.short: Shared digital ledger ‚Äì many computers store the same entries.
blockchain.desc: A blockchain is like a digital ledger. Many computers store the same entries, preventing anyone from secretly making changes.

wallet.title: Wallet
wallet.short: Digital wallet that manages your keys.
wallet.desc: A wallet is your digital purse. It manages the keys you need to access your account and send transactions. A wallet can be a program, an app, or even just a piece of paper with your private key.

account.title: Account
account.short: A blockchain account can hold assets and send transactions.
account.desc: An account is the place on the blockchain where your assets are stored. An account has a public address that begins with a G. Multiple wallets can access the same account if they have the correct key.

addressG.title: G-address
addressG.short: The public main address of a Stellar account (beginnt mit G).
addressG.desc: The G-address is the main address of a Stellar account. It starts with the letter G. You provide it to others so they can send you something.

publicKey.title: Public key
publicKey.short: Adresse, die du teilen darfst; bei Stellar meist die G‚ÄëAdresse.
publicKey.desc: The public key is the address you are allowed to show. In Stellar, this is the G-address. Others use it to send you money.

privateKey.title: Secret key
privateKey.short: Password for the account ‚Äì never share it.
privateKey.desc: The secret key is your password for the account. Anyone who has this key can move your money. Never share it.

addressFederation.title: Federation address
addressFederation.short: Kurze Adresse wie E‚ÄëMail, zeigt auf eine G‚ÄëAdresse.
addressFederation.desc: A federation address looks like an email. Example: name*domain.com. This short address points to a regular G-address. It's easier to remember.

addressMuxed.title: Muxed account
addressMuxed.short: M‚Äëaddress with additional ID ‚Äì shares a basic account.
addressMuxed.desc: An M-address points to an existing Stellar account but also has its own identifier (ID). This allows you to distinguish between multiple people or departments under the same G-address. Technically, the money still belongs to the main account.

multisig.title: Multisignature
multisig.short: Important actions require more than a signature.
multisig.desc: Multi-Sig stands for multiple signatures. An important action requires more than one key. For example, you and a second key both need to agree before something can be sent. This makes theft more difficult.

trustline.title: Trustline
trustline.short: Agreement to hold a token from a specific issuer.
trustline.desc:
A trustline is like a "yes, I accept this token." By doing so, you indicate that your account is ready to hold a certain token from a specific issuer. Without a trustline, you cannot receive this token.

Example: A trustline is specified as CODE:ISSUER. For EURT from the issuer GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y‚Ä¶, it is EURT:GDUKMGUGDZQK6Y‚Ä¶.

token.title: Token
token.short: Digital unit ‚Äì e.g., money, points, or credit.
token.desc: A token is a digital unit on the blockchain. A token can represent money, points, or credits for a service.

asset.title: Asset
asset.short: Tokens on Stellar are always associated with an issuer.
asset.desc: On Stellar, a token is called an asset. An asset is always associated with an issuing account. For example, an account can issue a Euro token. This Euro token is then an asset.

xlm.title: XLM
xlm.short: Native currency of Stellar for fees and activation.
xlm.desc: XLM is the base currency of Stellar. You need XLM to pay fees and to start a new account.

mainnet.title: Mainnet
mainnet.desc: The real Stellar network with actual value. Transactions are final, and fees are paid in real XLM.

testnet.title: Testnet
testnet.short: Public practice network without real value.
testnet.desc: A public testing network. Tokens have no real value. Ideal for learning and experimenting without risk.

memo.title: Memo
memo.desc: A memo is a small note that you can send along with a transaction. Often, an exchange requires a specific memo to know to whom the money belongs.

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.short: Action on the blockchain, e.g., payment or trustline.
transaction.desc: A transaction is an action on the blockchain, such as sending money or establishing a trustline. A transaction is permanently recorded once it is confirmed.

fee.title: Fee
fee.desc: The fee is a very small amount that you pay with each transaction. The fee goes to the network. On Stellar, the fees are very low.

ledger.title: Ledger
ledger.short: Chain of confirmed data and account balances.
ledger.desc: The ledger is the chain of all confirmed data. It contains information on which accounts own what amount and which transactions have occurred. Anyone can verify the ledger.

horizon.title: Horizon
horizon.short: API‚ÄëDienst, √ºber den Apps mit Stellar sprechen.
horizon.desc: Horizon is the service through which programs communicate with the Stellar Blockchain. Our tool queries Horizon to load account balances and transactions.

anchor.title: Anchor
anchor.short: Firma, die Fiat‚ÄëGeld mit Stellar verbindet.
anchor.desc: An anchor is a company that connects real money, such as euros or dollars, with Stellar. For example, you give the anchor euros, and in return, you receive a euro token on Stellar.

exchange.title: Stock exchange
exchange.short: Place to buy and sell tokens.
exchange.desc: An exchange is a place where you can buy or sell tokens. Many exchanges require a KYC process, which means verifying your identity, before you can withdraw money in euros or francs.

dex.title: DEX (Decentralized Exchange)
dex.short: Decentralized exchange directly on the blockchain.
dex.desc: DEX stands for Decentralized Exchange. Here, people trade directly with each other on the blockchain. There is no single operator. Stellar has a DEX built directly into it.

liquidityPool.title: Liquidity pool
liquidityPool.short: Common pool with two tokens for instant exchange.
liquidityPool.desc: A liquidity pool is a communal fund containing two tokens. People deposit both tokens into it. Others are then allowed to exchange these tokens instantly. The depositors earn small fees for this.

balanceClaimable.title: Claimable Balance
balanceClaimable.short: Reserved money that you still need to accept.
balanceClaimable.desc: A Claimable Balance is money that is already reserved for you, but you still need to claim it. It only goes into your account once you accept it.

protocolUpdate.title: Protocol Update
protocolUpdate.desc: A Protocol Update is an upgrade to the rules in the Stellar network, such as new features or security changes. All nodes in the network must use the same rules.

soroban.title: Soroban
soroban.desc: Soroban is the smart contract system of Stellar. A smart contract is program code on the blockchain. The code can independently verify rules and trigger actions without a bank intermediary.

mode.realWarning: Warning: Real Trustlines(s) will be deleted

deleted.notFound: No deletable trustlines found ‚Äì all still contain balances.

trustline.nonZeroBalance: This trustline cannot be deleted because it still has a balance.
trustline.onlyZeroBalanceInfo: Only trustlines with a balance of 0 can be deleted.

lesson1.title: What is a blockchain
lesson1.task: Assemble building blocks (Transaktionen) into a chain
lesson1.learningOutcome: A blockchain is an immutable digital ledger that everyone collectively verifies.

lesson2.title: Understand Stellar
lesson2.goal: Know the difference from other blockchains.
lesson2.task: Send token to friend (Simulation) and see speed
lesson2.learningOutcome: Stellar is fast, inexpensive, and without mining.

lesson3.title: Public & Privacy
lesson3.task: View public transaction and guess whether the sender is known
lesson3.learningOutcome: Everything is visible, but no one knows the real name.

lesson4.title: Your account
lesson4.goal: Understand the structure and significance of public/private key pairs.
lesson4.task: Matching Game: What is Public, What is Secret
lesson4.learningOutcome: Only the secret key grants access, the public key can be shared.

lesson5.title: Send & Receive
lesson5.goal: Understanding the Functionality of Transactions and Trustlines
lesson5.task: Execute test shipment and view fee.
lesson5.learningOutcome: Each transaction incurs a small fee; Trustline = permission to receive.

lesson6.title: Token & Trading
lesson6.task: Place tokens on a virtual marketplace and monitor price changes.
lesson6.learningOutcome: Price is determined by supply and demand.

lesson7.title: Security
lesson7.task: Sorting right/wrong actions; identifying fake tokens
lesson7.learningOutcome: Confidentiality of the key, secure storage, and using a testnet.

lesson8.title: Verification & Identity
lesson8.learningOutcome: KYC = Identity verification, verification shows trusted tokens.

lesson9.title: Zero Knowledge
lesson9.task: Example scenario 'I am over 18' without showing the date of birth
lesson9.learningOutcome: You can prove something without revealing secrets.

lesson10.title: Practice with SKM
lesson10.task: Create an account on the testnet, activate it, set a trustline, send tokens.
lesson10.learningOutcome: Trace the technical processes of a transaction.

lesson11.title: Responsibility
lesson11.task: Decision Game: To Act Correctly or Not
lesson11.learningOutcome: Blockchain is final; due diligence is a must.

lesson12.title: Conclusion / Playful Learning
lesson12.learningOutcome: Review what you've learned, recognize your own progress.
